intro: Microchilus forceps, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandwort, is a small, perennial plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, linear leaves and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its stems are usually prostrate or ascending, and it produces capsules as its fruiting structure. Microchilus forceps is often found in rocky crevices or along dry streambeds, showcasing its adaptation to harsh environments.
